data.title: Added 3D freelook navigation mode
data.body:
- Triggered by holding RMB
- Can look around in FPS style
- Can move with WASD, up and down with Q and E
- Movement speed accelerates over time
- Can multiply speed with a modifier key to go faster or slower
- Configurable in editor settings and shortcuts

Preview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lmFVNVHTBFk&feature=youtu.be

This PR gives an alternative to the shortcomings found in #8260

data.title: Editor doesn't detect external scene changes and silently overwrites file
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac OS X 10.11.6, Windows 10
Godot version v2.1.3.stable.offical

**Issue description:**
When updating a scene outside the Godot instance, it is overwritten without any warnings / messages etc.

This means that in practice - you have to close down a scene before doing things like for example git sync. One could discuss the practice of editing the same scene at once, but a least a warning or an indicator or similar would have been beneficial. Other parts of Godot handle automatic reloading and many editors warn you about file changes outside the disk. We discovered this during LD and it became hard to  patch stuff up.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Start an empty project
2. Add a root node of any type
3. Add 2 children of the root node of any type
4. Save the instance as .tscn
5. In another Godot instance or a plain text editor, remove the second child and save the file
6. Return to the first Godot instance and Run the scene 
7. If you inspect the .tscn, you see that the second child has returned (like a creepy horror movie)

**Link to minimal example project:**
Not needed

data.title: Pack Mode: Pack into archive file (*.zip) --> Add support for password protection?
data.body:
Hi Everyone,

I noted that in the "Pack Mode" options for exporting a project, you can choose "Pack into archive file (.zip)" as one of the targets. Would it be possible to add password protection as well to this archive as a feature? The reason being, it would be helpful in deterring cheaters, modders, etc. 

I suppose the "Pack into executable" and "Pack into binary file (.pck)" option provide slightly better protection against cheaters and moddification, but I'm not sure by how much? Probably still better than a standard ZIP file which can be opened and tampered with via any modern archive program?

data.title: Make script debugger display all kinds of objects
data.body:
Makes @bojidar-bg 's idea from #4103 reality.
After some thinking, I decided to use the inspector in the left dock since the arrays are displayed there too, but that can be changed, to e. g. the remote inspector tab in the debugger, although that may be a bit weird.

data.title: Make property editor display dictionaries (read only)
data.body:
Resolves the original issue in #4103
For now, it only converts the dictionaries to string, then displays them as static text, but a proper dictionary editor and the ability to inspect all kinds of object in the debugger (as suggested by @bojidar-bg in the issue) is in the works too.

data.title: Buggy collision detection when ConvexPolygonShape2D is given a concave polygon with set_points()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 - Godot 2.1.3 win64

**Issue description:**
I have a Polygon2D, and I am trying to create a static rigidbody with the polygons shape through code:

```
extends Polygon2D
func _ready():
	
	var shape = ConvexPolygonShape2D.new()
	shape.set_points(get_polygon())
	
	var body = RigidBody2D.new()
	body.set_mode(RigidBody2D.MODE_STATIC)
	body.add_shape(shape)
	add_child(body)
```

This works fine if the polygon is actually convex, but for concave polygons the collision detection breaks:

https://gfycat.com/WideNaiveDwarfrabbit

The left and right polygons are polygon2D's with the above script. The bottom polygon was created in the editor and has the expected behavior. It looks like ConvexPolygonShape2D doesn't decompose concave polygons when using set_points(). Is there a class that can do this?


**Link to minimal example project:**
Example project from the gif: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_tU7BWC-5CkY0JGNWpuU1ZVWFk

Drive link because:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5416313/25585651/eb637cc4-2e58-11e7-9e5c-c45ff2e14e80.png)
When I drop in a zip.

data.title: Rename project file to "project.godot"
data.body:
Slimmed down variant from the reverted #8375.
The rationale behind the name change is to give Godot's project file a unique
extension (".godot") that can be registered on the OS to be associated with
the Godot binary (OS registration not implemented here).

This PR also adds the possibility to start the game or editor if launched
with the project.godot passed as argument, which paves the way for allowing
a similar behaviour on a double-click in the OS file manager (code originally
by @Hinsbart).

Closes #6915.

data.title: Raycast2D Visible Collider Arrowpoints drawn incorrectly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 Custom Build April 20th
Windows 10 and MacOSX El Capitan

**Issue description:**
When using Raycast2D nodes, the visible collision shapes in-editor and for the runtime debug option draw at partially incorrect angles. The lines are correct but the arrowheads are not.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Using a RayCast2D node, set the cast-to point as 0, -a and the line will appear pointing upwards, but the arrow-head will be to the right and pointing right. A line pointing to 0, +a has an arrowhead to the left and pointing left.
![screen shot 2017-05-01 at 9 53 50 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7831502/25581226/79dff1ee-2e54-11e7-9394-78d9c0cf2afc.png)

data.title: Collision shapes are drawn in wrong color and collision contact points are not drawn at all
data.body:
**Ubuntu - Godot version: 3.0 master**


**Issue description:**
Collision display debug options, draw collision shape in wrong color (gray instead one selected in Project Settings) and don't draw contact points at all.

data.title: Multiple Custom Themes
data.body:
Disclaimer: This is really low priority.

Allowing for stacking themes would be really nice to use a custom theme and override the styles where  users are not satisfied with. or keeping one personal preference (the same background color than your oparating systems window color...) always as the top of the stack and switching theme from time to time

data.title: Custom editor theme paths (how to install editor themes)
data.body:
I'm always having issues installing custom themes. I don't know if I'm doing something wrong or if installing is just really cumbersome.
A theme created in the editor has res:// paths to the resources (images) it uses. when I set a custom editor theme the resources are only there if they are part of the current project I'm working on...
OR
if I adapt every singe url in the theme file... (that works with a install script but I just want to choose the theme and it should work!!)

*feature I'm asking for*
It would be nice if the exported themes would allow for relative paths so I can package them into a Folder and the editor would find the theme png's for every project!

Another cool approach would be to save themes as packaged files with all the recources in it. Than the packed folder could be read loaded as the theme and shared. (again with relative paths in the theme file)

data.title: StyleBoxFlat more customisable
KinematicBody2D move leaks some unexpected motion colliding with static
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows, 64-bit, v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
Trying to make a kinematic character stick to the ground when walking (so as to not lift off due to momentum when walking fast over bumps).
Working method is to move horizontally, add slide, then move downwards a little faster than the fastest possible walking speed, and if that doesn't collide, undo it and switch to "falling" mode because you've walked off a cliff not down a slope. :)
This latter downward move is *not* followed by a slide, but nevertheless results in the character slowly moving downhill when trying to stand still on a slope. The vectors returned by the various move calls are (0, 0) from the "move horizontally no distance" move, then (0, 3.27ish) from the floor-sticking vertical move - so it's suggested by these return values that no horizontal movement is occurring, but nevertheless the character slowly moves horizontally.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a 45 degree diagonal sloping static collider and a kinetic body that acts this way. Try to stand the kinetic body still on the slope. Sample attached.
The cut down code segment:
```
const WALK_SPEED = 200.0
var velocity = Vector2()

func _fixed_process(delta):
		velocity.y = 0
		if (Input.is_action_pressed(global.MOVE_LEFT)):
			velocity.x = - WALK_SPEED
		elif (Input.is_action_pressed(global.MOVE_RIGHT)):
			velocity.x =   WALK_SPEED
		else:
			velocity.x = 0.0
		var motion = velocity * delta
		motion = move(motion)
		if (is_colliding()):
			var n = get_collision_normal()
			motion = n.slide(motion)
			move(motion)
		# stick to the ground
		motion = Vector2(0, WALK_SPEED*1.01*delta)
		motion = move(motion)
		if (!is_colliding()):
			revert_motion()
			print("falling")
			state = STATE.AIRBORNE
		else:
			# fix the leak of x-motion
			print(motion)
```

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Megajoust.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/967294/Megajoust.zip)

data.title: Area2D: error displayed on console but not in editor
data.body:
EDIT: Updated title to reflect that this issue is really due to the following error:

    ERROR: Function blocked during in/out signal. Use call_deferred("set_enable_monitoring",true/false)
   At: scene\2d\area_2d.cpp:429

However, the error does not appear when running the project in the Godot editor.  The error *does* appear when running the project from the command line.

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X/ Linux - 2.1.2/2.1.3

**Issue description:**
Area2D node with body_enter signal connected to a function.  Monitoring cannot be disabled in that function.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Connect the signal and create a function:

    func _ready():
        connect("body_enter", self, "_on_body_enter")

    func _on_body_enter( body ):
        set_enable_monitoring(false)
        print(is_monitoring_enabled())

Result is `True'

Placing those two lines in any other function (`_ready()` or `_process()` for example) works as expected - 'False' is displayed.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Example - 1 moving body & one area2d.
[area2d_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/967173/area2d_test.zip)

`./drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.h:37:10: fatal error: 'GLES3/gl3.h' file not found`

**Issue description:**

I am trying to build Godot 3.0 for the web. I have successfully built the same code base for x11 and have built a similar codebase for windows. The error only occurs when building for javascript.

data.title: Remembering the the last opened scenes/scripts tabs before closing godot fo each project
data.body: I wonder if it's gonna be useful if all your opened tabs (scenes/scripts) stay right there as you left them last time before you close your project, without start looking to open them each time instead of open the main scene only ?

data.title: Node.set_owner is shallow
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 on an amd64, Godot 2.1.3 stable.

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I'm trying to make a tool script that doesn't just create a new node, but also a second node as a child of the first one. When I run this script, only the first node is created, not the second node.
**EDIT:** after looking at other examples like tilesethelper, I found out that this doesn't work because `Node.set_owner` is shallow and doesn't account for an ownership hierarchy.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a Node, which I will call `test` for reference.
2. Add the following script to it:
```
tool
extends Node

export(bool) var reset = false setget _on_reset

func _on_reset(value):
	if (value):
		reset = false
		for child in get_children():
			child.free()
		var new_node = Node.new()
		add_child(new_node)
		new_node.set_owner(self)
		new_node.set_name("new_node")
		var new_sprite = Sprite.new()
		new_node.add_child(new_sprite)
		new_sprite.set_owner(new_node)
		new_sprite.set_name("new_sprite")
		new_sprite.set_texture(preload("res://icon.png")) # or whatever image you want
```
3. Click the `Reset` checkbox to run the script. In the scene tree you can see that `new_node` was created but it doesn't have a child called `new_sprite`. However, in the editor viewport (not when playing the scene), the sprite is being drawn on the screen!

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[tool-script-can't-create-a-node-hierarchy.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/967027/tool-script-can.t-create-a-node-hierarchy.zip)

data.title: Console closes when error received with debugging enabled
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
v2.1.3 latest

**Issue description:**
Exporting a debugging enabled game when there is an error, causes you to NOT see the error, because it closes the console and game client.

Example: 
![](https://i.gyazo.com/6ec25d64496c4abf9708bdd01024a4eb.gif)
And these are two errors with that scene preview:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/25568084/56479a38-2db0-11e7-9dd7-db587c76b8a1.png)

And the game client still works fine. _This is good!_

## HOWEVER

If you try the same thing when exported **with debugging enabled**, look what happens:
![](https://i.gyazo.com/542f3a43b44f071a3ae2153d7fcc5bd5.gif)


I'm not sure if that is intended, but shouldn't the game client just close, and the console remain open so we can see the error messages still? Instead of everything closing?

data.title: Typing anything in shader editor without node selected crashes godot
data.body:
Godot 3.0 april 30th build Kubuntu 17.04 x64

Godot exits with console message "type is:"

STR: Open shader editor by pressing "Shader" menu button on bottom panel. Type anything into editor.

data.title: built-in scripts do not show up in the navigator editor beside the other scripts when you reopen godot
data.body:
Windows 10 64 bit - Godot version: Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64

the built-in scripts do not appear with the other external scripts, (I'm talking here in the navigator that has all scripts name beside the code editor) 
I just start godot and i saw in some old tutorials that they show up just fine , but that not happen with me and i have to go for every single node that have buil-in script in it and open it from there every time i reopen godot

data.title: Fix godot project extension not recognized (again)
data.body: This fixes that playing a godot project opens the project manager.

data.title: Scene importer: add -rigidonly flag for empties [master]
data.body:
Version of https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/8435 `cherry-pick`ed for `master`. I unfortunately was unable to test this, but it does compile.

If https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/8435 is merged for 2.1, this should be merged for master at the same time.

data.title: Added Curve resource
data.body:
- New resource for curves in y(x) form
- CurveTexture now has a Curve
- Curve and CurveTexture share the same editor

For #7296, can also be used for #8504, or more wherever curves are a thing

data.title: Use libsquish to decompress DXT textures.
data.body:
Also ensure that save_png doesn't modify the image.

Removed the broken decompressor in the process.

data.title: Use correct mode for DXT1 textures.
data.body:
libsquish, which is used to generate all S3TC textures, works only with RGBA textures.

Fixes #8550.

data.title: Some styles can't be changed with imported editor themes
data.body:
Godot 3.0 30th april build linux x64 Kubuntu 17.04 

Changing resource for PanelContainer class does not change editor theming like it was doing in previous versions. 
STR: Make a theme, assign it as editor theme and try changing PanelContainer properties

![spectacle wl5593](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/25560207/4d2bb272-2d56-11e7-810f-ae3bbd632454.png)

ItemList class bg property is broken the same way but bg focus works fine

Button also gets inherited by all sorts of stuff and if you add any change to it's style items classes like CheckBox and switch in color picker get messed up. Changing their values to space out text and icon doesn't do anything.

data.title: Overwriting scene using "save as scene" causes node to get replaced with existing scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, godot ver 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Tried to save node as a scene, given prompt "scene exists, overwrite?", chose to overwrite, node I tried to save was replaced. Unable to recover lost data.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Follow steps above
